newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Apple South in freefall.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Apple South in freefall.

text.p: Shares in restaurant operator Apple South Inc lost almost half their market value preceding Wednesday's U.S. market open in selling sparked by the company's earnings warning last night, traders said.
In vigorous pre-open trade, the stock fell as low as 11 from yesterday's 20-7/8 Nasdaq close, according to Instinet.
In later pre-open action, the stock rose to 12.
After Tuesday's market close, the company said 1996 earnings would fall short of analysts' estimates of $0.95 per share because of a sluggish restaurant environment and management turnover.
Apple South said its 1996 earnings would be modestly above those of 1995, before merger and asset revaluation charges.
In other pre-open activity, 3Com Corp shares extened gains that began in after-hours trading last night following a positive quarterly earnings report.
Early on Wednesday the stock rose to 61, up from 56-5/8 at Tuesday's regular-session close and above the 58-3/4 reached in after-hours action.
3Com said earnings for the fiscal first quarter ended August 31 rose to $0.52 per share, $0.05 above the First Call consensus forecast and up from $0.33 a year earlier.
Revenues for the quarter soared to $707 million from $497 million a year earlier, it said.

Traders said the 3Com news encouraged buying in other technology issues. Cisco Systems Inc added one to 61-1/2, Novell rose to 11-1/8 from 10-7/8, Bay Networks added 5/8 to 30-1/8, and Intel gained 1/2 to 97.
